Very tricky quizzes and Week 3 needs to be re-done.
not practicle at all.

I am not planning on completing this course. I went through the material for the first week and did not find it useful at all. In fact, I found it quite demoralizing. I also found the required exercises absolutely too invasive and personal to submit and share with complete strangers, so that is why I do not plan to continue.
basic

It was comprehensive 
learned key markers of resume designing

His content was good. I liked the way he focused on the point of the resume is to get you the interview. He also did a good job at trying to get you to think about what the employer wants and developing your resume accordingly. The assessments could use improvement. The questions and answers were worded in a confusing manner. And the peer reviews were dependent on having peers available to review your work or having work for you to review, which delayed my progress. For a course like this, there should be straight forward assessments that test your understanding of the content, and I think there is room for improvement here.
Useful but the way the instructor presents the lectures can be more creative.

This course covered the fundamentals of resume writing; however, it was somewhat outdated as it was still mentioning sending necessary application documents via snail mail (despite a discussion about ATS). What was most distressing is that I posted several questions and comments - some of which were a request for help - and never once could I find a response. Please do not set up a Discussion Forum if no one is going to monitor it and respond!

Lots of good info, but a bit heavy to get through without feeling overwhelmed. Job hunting is an exhausting task in itself, so I was missing some uplifting bite-size elements to keep me motivated to implement the things suggested in this course. The overall feeling of the course was that it's a bit outdated, but the material is useful.
good course, but need to pay for tests
P‚Äãeer review doesn't really work. Most students don't submit real assignments.

Writing resumes: in this section I learned the different types of resumes, how and when to use each one of them. Cover letter: I don't think it was enough, no much detalies have been mentioned.However, the course is highly recommended for job or college resumes.

It provides great ideas and lots of examples and good material to make good Resumes and CVs, but it is very oriented to the U.S.A. market and it is difficult to complete the tasks on time due to lack of peer material to review.

Good course to take to refresh your resume skills and/or help revamp your resume completely. BUT, very frustrating having to wait for assignments to be marked by peers. I have been waiting up to 3-4 days for my assignments to be marked and as a result I cancelled my subscription.
Easyest course of the specializaton. No worth if you miss other courses of the spec.
This course is a must=do because it helps your resume stands out from the rest
Loved every minute of it. Would surely recommend my friends & family this course.  Shoutout to amazing instructor and COURSERA for this platform. üôèüëçüëå
‚ÄãOutstanding Experienced, I was able to learn how to develop a resume and cover letter

The professor has a healthy sense of humor, thank you, prof, which made the course more enjoyable. The questions were a bit tricky but I enjoyed retaking them. Overall the course is insightful, now I have a better idea of what a resume should look like.
This course is very beneficial. This course includes pro tips for resume and cover letter writing. I highly recommend this course to everyone.
good
good

Outstanding Course!! I have learned a lot during this period of instructions. This course really helped me with basic rules of cover letters. I have  learned a lot of additional resumes that could be written.
good
Very Very excellent course. I advice every one to enrol in it
best
It has been a great experience, thank you so much

I have gained tremendous insight in what resume format was best for my teaching background. I am going to continue to develop my competencies and accomplishments. Thank you for the insight on how to approach my cover letter with a sense of urgency.
had an amazing experience

Very detailed program.  I am now in a position to tailor my resume to suit
Such a useful course. Highly recommended to anyone who wants to hone their resume writing skills. Great opportunity to learn.

good course

I enjoyed this course. Thank you!
This course primarily focuses on self development, great course.

I have been working in the same industry for 25 years when the pandemic struck. This course was exactly what I needed to revamp my resume and start looking for a new career path. It answered all of the questions I had about how to create a modern resume. The guidance on cover letters and notes has reminded me of job search etiquette that I had forgotten. Thank you
I really enjoyed it! Good content, to the point. I wish there would be more participants, so that the assignments reviews take less time.
Very helpful, step-by step guide in writing effective cover letter and resumes. Provide ample examples and tutor can explain topics succinctly.
Very interesting and useful course and just perfect tutor!
Highly recommend, really goes beyond the basis .
Very beneficial for professionals into career coaching, training, and teaching professional course students

This was a good class. It was more challenging than I expected so I was a little thrown off. However, it is a self-paced class and you are able to re-take quizzes within a certain time period in order to improve your quiz score, but it must be 80% or higher to pass each quiz. The information is very helpful in writing resumes and cover letters according to the job market in today's century.

It is probably the best course that can take to learn resume and cover letter writing. Being a resume writer I learned that a lot of things I did were wrong. This course provided me with so many tools and information. Thanks to the instructor. A suggestion I have is that to add a section where you explain the CV format used outside the US (for all purposes) and that will cover almost everything regarding resume writing. All in all, I am very satisfied with the content of the course
Very innovative and practical course which may increase your chances of being noticed by potential employers.
Extremely helpful !
This course has broaden my knowledge on resume writing.
It was  a great course, I came away with new knowledge
This is a great course and it helps you to learn how to write a high-quality resume.
It is a detailed course... a lot of new contents that i never found on any other site specially in such an organized manner. highly recommended.
Its very good course
I went over the resume writing, and it is a breakthrough the way it is presented. I loved the training and left me motivated.

I felt so much more confident after taking this course! I acquired the necessary vocabulary to make my resume and cover letters stand out! Fingers crossed I will receive job offers. I am very grateful this course was offered!

The best resumes writing course I have ever had.The lecturer Charles Duquette is outstanding. I love his presence and charisma. I even remind me of Tywin Lannister (my favorite character in Game of Thrones)This course is rich with extra material for me to read after the lectures.Thank you so much for this course. I helped me a lot.
Engaging and very helpful.

Excellent course. Very informative. Also for me as living in Germany it was very interesting to find out about some cultural differences in writting winning resumes. The course is well founded and Mr Duquette is very credible.

Hands down this is the best course on understanding resume writing. If you are looking for a course to understand the basics of cover letter writing and resume writing, then this is the course you absolutely need to take. The instructor, Mr. Duquette has done such a fabulous job, right from creating the content to explaining it. The language is really simple and very clearly explained (with examples). I can not thank Mr. Duquette enough for putting together this very concise and well-explanined course. I have truly learned a great deal.
good course
very useful, thank you very much
Good advising for developing effective resume.
Completed
Outstanding Experience
It was an eye opener and pointed out what we so foolishly overlook while writing resumes.
Very helpful and accurate
Simplistic, direct and informative.  This course helped me refocus my competencies and updated my resume writing strategies.  Great examples and resources to utilize.

This course was much more informative and helpful than I had imagined it would be. The videos were all worthwhile, along with the quizzes and assignments. For me, returning to the workforce after a prolonged absence, the insights regarding the job recruitment process in today's world were invaluable. I have been inspired, motivated and encouraged! I am very grateful I had the opportunity to study this subject, and have already signed up for the other courses related to this one.
This course is very helpful. Thank you.
Very useful and informative course covering key aspects to be taken while writing resumes...

It is an excellent course. Anyone who is new or old to the current job market must consider taking it. I will highly recommend since I learned new strategy and insight into how to write Resumes, Cover Letter and Follow-Up letter and most importantly what I shouldn't do to jeopardize my chances of success. I may revisit other areas as time permits.. Thank You.
helpful!!
Excellent, It was concise but without missing details, It also included a lot of examples. Thank You.
One of the most compelling and amazing courses on Coursera. Teaches you the essentials required to survive in the 'market'.
Informative and practical.
Extremelly clearifying. The directions are comprehensible, and the course helped me to increase the job opportunities dramatically!
Very helpful insights and great examples!
Practical and usefu

Every time one hear if you are not getting an interview call then it means your resume  writing skills are not excellent,  you are not able to project your self, you are not able sell your self or you might be overqualified / under-qualified. If you ask them for help, 90% are not in a position to guide you, 9% would support you, provide some reasons, but you still you feel handicap. I am lucky to find my 1% who hold my hand and walked me through each stage , educated me with the explanation why to write like this way in 21st century.  In my view it is the right time everyone must gain this skill of  21st century resume  and cover letter writing .  We need to overwrite now, the old traditional way of resume and cover letter writing.Thanks to  Charles Duquette and Daniela C. Wagner-Loera for making this excellent course easy to understand.
G
I really liked this course because it is very specific, shows very good examples and provides practical resources.
